news.title: [Sample news post] Brace Yourself: OSLC Steering Committee Elections Are Coming
news.next: Neither Proprietary Data Formats nor International Travel are barriers to OSLC
news.previous: OSLC Enables Integration for Mobility and Lean Software Lifecycles

posts.title: Brace Yourself: OSLC Steering Committee Elections Are Coming
posts.desc: This June, three OSLC Steering Committee seats are up for election. Prepare to participate in the elections to influence the future of OSLC.

posts.title: Neither Proprietary Data Formats nor International Travel are barriers to OSLC
posts.desc: OSLC news for the ALM Forum attendee newsletter for April 3: the OSLC International Speakers Bureau takes the stage.

posts.title: OSLC Enables Integration for Mobility and Lean Software Lifecycles
posts.desc: Yesterday (April Fool's Day) OSLC didn't fool around putting two talks 'in the books' and having a good BoF discussion. Things keep rolling today with talks about Mobile and Lean.

posts.title: OSLC Standardization underway for Automation and Project Management of Contracted Delivery at OASIS
posts.desc: Two new OSLC Technical Committees, both addressing critical themes for today's delivery organizations, but from very different perspectives, have their first meetings.

posts.title: Connect with OSLC at the ALM Forum
posts.desc: We’re just days away from the ALM Forum in Seattle (it runs April 1-3), and the first ever “OSLC Connect” event is taking place as part of it. If you haven’t registered yet, but can attend, don’t miss out on using the OSLC discount code (learn more).

posts.title: Don’t get stressed talking about integrations
posts.desc: Join the OSLC leaders for an “Integration Happy Hour” March 31 from 4:30-6:30 PM at the ALM Forum in Seattle.

posts.title: Follow along as we redesign in public
posts.desc: I'm exploring an updated design for this site, and I’m doing so in public. This'll be fun.

posts.title: Eclipse Lyo 2.1 released, and other news you need to know
posts.desc: Eclipse Lyo 2.1 is now available! In addition to the many improvements to what was available in Lyo 2.0, a Hudson CI adapter for OSLC Automation has been added to this release.

posts.title: Two new OSLC Technical Committees form and Call for Participation
posts.desc: OSLC Automation and OSLC PROMCODE.

posts.title: Getting Started Developing OSLC Applications is now at Github
posts.desc: You'll now find our guide 'Get started with developing OSLC applications' at its new home at Github.

resource.title: [Sample resource] OSLC Community Update and An Introduction to PROMCODE

Blog posts.title: Upcoming presentation: Community Update and An Introduction to PROMCODE

posts.title: Integrating products with OSLC
posts.desc: This tutorial explains how to integrate tools with OSLC. The tutorial uses examples, starting with simple ones and building to more advanced topics such as implementing an OSLC Provider.

posts.title: OSLC Primer
posts.desc: A primer for technical leaders who want to understand the concepts and goals of OSLC and its relationship to other standards for evaluation, as well as potential OSLC implementers who want a general overview of the OSLC concepts and an understanding of the thinking and use-cases that led to their definition.

posts.title: Getting Started with Developing OSLC Applications
posts.desc: An overview for adding OSLC support to your software.

posts.title: Eclipse Lyo
posts.desc: The Eclipse Lyo project focuses on providing an SDK to help the Eclipse community to adopt OSLC specifications and build OSLC-compliant tools. The source code is available in a Git repository.

posts.title: OSLC Community Update and An Introduction to PROMCODE
posts.desc: Sean Kennedy will provide a quick update on the status of the OSLC Community, including the new Technical Committees at OASIS and the upcoming OSLC Connect event at the ALM Forum.

posts.title: Reducing system integration costs with OSLC and data federation
posts.desc: In this session we will discuss how organizations can save time and money when integrating applications through data federation and OSLC.

posts.title: OSLC4Net
posts.desc: OSLC4Net is an SDK and sample applications to help the .NET community to adopt OSLC (Open Services for Lifecycle Collaboration) and build OSLC-compliant tools.

posts.title: Build your own ServiceProvider (with preview!) in no time
posts.desc: Dibbe Edwards of IBM and Andreas Keis of EADS discuss the benefits of OSLC in this presentation from IBM Pulse 2013.

posts.title: Introduction to Linked Data Concepts and OSLC
posts.desc: An example-packed introduction to linked data concepts and how they apply to Open Services for Lifecycle Collaboration.

posts.title: Build your own ServiceProvider (with preview!) in no time
posts.desc: Vijay Kalangumvathakkal of IBM Tivoli provides two sample web modules to help you set up OSLC ServiceProviders and try out UI Previews.

posts.title: OSLC Enablement Roadmap
posts.desc: This document has a collection of links to resources (and a recommended order to follow them) to help you get up to speed with OSLC.

posts.title: Getting Excited for Eclipse Lyo 1.0
posts.desc: Sean Kennedy interviews Kartik Kanakasabesan about why he's excited about the Eclipse Lyo 1.0 Official Release. Learn about what Eclipse Lyo provides and why this matters to you.

steering-committee.title: Steering Committee
steering-committee.note-to-self: needs to be more-kick-assy per Steve eg http://www.eclipse.org/org/foundation/directors.php which isn't particularly kick-assy but better than what we have

workgroups.title: [Sample] Workgroups
workgroups.listing_description: We have a variety of working groups—here and at various standards organizations—with different and occasionally overlapping interests, roles, and responsibilities.

workgroups.title: Sterring Committee
workgroups.microdesc: Governing body that approves new workgroups, specifications

workgroups.title: Core TC
workgroups.microdesc: Integrating software with linked data at OASIS

workgroups.title: Linked Data Platform
workgroups.microdesc: Integrating software with linked data at OASIS

workgroups.title: RDF Data Shapes
workgroups.microdesc: Defining and validating the structure of RDF data

workgroups.title: Automation TC
workgroups.microdesc: Reducing manual interactions in all phases of software development and operations

workgroups.title: Change and Configuration Management TC
workgroups.microdesc: Tasks, defects, assets, and configurations at OASIS

workgroups.title: PROMCODE TC
workgroups.microdesc: Exchanging project management information across organizational boundaries

workgroups.microdesc: Common problems with finding, creating, and updating resources

workgroups.microdesc: Product definition and versions

specifications.title: Core 3.0
specifications.microdesc: A collection of specifications that defines the basic patterns and protocols that any OSLC software must implement and that can be independently adopted with minimal interdependencies.

specifications.microdesc: Simple read-write Linked Data architecture using HTTP access and RDF data.
